intro: Piper rubellum, commonly known as the red pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its small, red, peppery fruits. The plant produces clusters of small, green flowers that develop into the distinctive red berries. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a peppery aroma when crushed. Piper rubellum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of spice.
